member.summary: Adds a text annotation to the in the document.

members.member:
Adds an URI annotation to the in the document.
Region on the page where the annotation needs to be added. URI linked by the annotation. Note A Uniform Resource Identifier is usually a link to a website, FTP host or an e-mail address. When the end-user selects a URI annotation, the PDF viewer application or the underlying OS resolves (launches) the link.

Adds a launch annotation to the in the document.
Pathname of the application or document linked by the annotation. Region on the page where the annotation needs to be added. Note When an end-user selects a launch annotation, the viewer application executes an application or asks the underlying OS to open/print a document with its default application.

Adds a go-to annotation to the in the document.
Region on the page where the annotation needs to be added. Number of the page linked by the annotation. Note When the end-user selects a go-to annotation, the viewer application navigates to a page linked by the annotation.

Adds a remote-go-to annotation to the in the document.
Pathname of the PDF document that the viewer application should display when the end\-user selects this annotation. Region on the page where the annotation needs to be added. Number of the page in the other PDF document that the viewer application should skip over to when it displays that document. Note A remote go-to annotation links to another PDF document. When the end-user selects a remote go-to annotation, the PDF viewer application opens the other PDF document.

member.summary: Adds a named-action annotation to the in the document.
member.param: Named action that the viewer application should execute when the end\-user selects the annotation.
Region on the page where the annotation needs to be added.

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.CstPDFDoc.AddBookmark(System.String,Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFBookmark,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Adds a bookmark to a PDF document which leads to a particular location on a page. The page zoom can be specified.
member.param: string which will appear as a prompt for the bookmark in the outline view.
The name of the bookmark under which this bookmark will be located. null if the bookmark needs to be located at the top\-most level.
integer value specifying the page number to which the bookmark leads when clicked.
float value specifying the left offset from (0, top) position on the page.
float value specifying the top offset from (left, 0) position on the page.
float value specifying the percentage of zoom in which the target page has to be displayed.
member.remarks: The measurement unit can be changed using the PDFMeasurementUnit enumeration. If a non-existent page number is specified the bookmark will not be created.

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.CstPDFDoc.AddBookmark(System.String,Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFBookmark,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a bookmark to a PDF document which leads to a page.
member.param: string which will appear as a prompt for the bookmark in the outline view.
The name of the bookmark under which this bookmark will be located. null if the bookmark needs to be located at the top\-most level.
integer value specifying the page number to which the bookmark leads when clicked.
member.remarks: If an incorrect page number is specified the bookmark will not appear.

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.CstPDFDoc.AddBookmark(System.String,Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFBookmark,System.Int32,System.Single,Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFFit)
member.summary: Adds a bookmark to a PDF document which leads to a particular area on a page. The page fits as specified in the view.
member.param: string which will appear as a prompt for the bookmark in the outline view.
The name of the bookmark under which this bookmark will be located. null if the bookmark needs to be located at the top\-most level.
integer value specifying the page number to which the bookmark leads when clicked.
The offset from the top (in case of horizontal fit) or left (in case of vertical fit) of the page which should be applied.
Any of the PDFFit enumerated values which specify how the page should fit in the view.
member.remarks: If an incorrect page number is specified the bookmark will not appear. The measurement unit can be changed using the PDFMeasurementUnit enumeration. The result due to the pos value specified will vary in combinations of pane size and fit applied. At times the pos offset may not be applied. This will also depend on the viewer being used.

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.CstPDFDoc.AddBookmark(System.String,Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFBookmark,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a bookmark to a PDF document which leads to a page and specifies whether the page view can be optimally magnified to fit the boundaries of the window or pane.
member.param: string which will appear as a prompt for the bookmark in the outline view.
The name of the bookmark under which this bookmark will be located. null if the bookmark needs to be located at the top\-most level.
integer value specifying the page number to which the bookmark leads when clicked.
boolean value, which specifies whether to fit the maximum page contents in a maximum zoom view.
member.remarks: If an incorrect page number is specified the bookmark will not appear.

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.CstPDFDoc.AddBookmark(System.String,Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFBookmark,System.Int32,System.Drawing.RectangleF)
member.summary: Adds a bookmark to a PDF document which leads to a rectangular area on a page.
member.param: string which will appear as a prompt for the bookmark in the outline view.
The name of the bookmark under which this bookmark will be located. null if the bookmark needs to be located at the top\-most level.
integer value specifying the page number to which the bookmark leads when clicked.
A RectangleF object specifying the location on the page which will be brought in view.
member.remarks: If an non-existent page number is specified the bookmark will not appear. The measurement unit can be changed using the PDFMeasurementUnit enumeration.

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.CstPDFDoc.AddBookmark(System.String,Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFBookmark,Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFActionName)
member.summary: Adds a bookmark to a PDF document which executes a pre-defined action as enumerated in PDFActionName.

member.summary: Adds a bookmark to a PDF document which runs a JavaScript.

The JavaScript syntax which needs to be executed when the bookmark is clicked.

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.CstPDFDoc.AddBookmark(System.String,Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFBookmark,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a bookmark to a PDF document which opens or prints a PDF or non-PDF file.
member.param: string which will appear as a prompt for the bookmark in the outline view.
The name of the bookmark under which this bookmark will be located. null if the bookmark needs to be located at the top\-most level.
The complete path of the local or network file to be opened or printed when this bookmark is clicked. Supply necessary escape sequence character(s).
If this boolean value is true, the file will be printed. If false it will be opened for viewing on the screen.
member.remarks: Using generic pathname a file can also be opened from over the network.

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.CstPDFDoc.AddBookmark(System.String,Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFBookmark,System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a bookmark to a PDF document which opens another PDF document and allows traversal to a particular page.
member.param: string which will appear as a prompt for the bookmark in the outline view.
The name of the bookmark under which this bookmark will be located. null if the bookmark needs to be located at the top\-most level.
The complete path of the local or network PDF document to be opened. Supply necessary escape sequence character(s).
integer value specifying the page number which has to be brought in view.
boolean value, true if the target PDF document has to be opened in a new window, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Using generic pathname a file can also be opened from over the network. If a non-existent destination page number is specified, then on click of added bookmark the page pointed in destination PDF file is unpredictable.

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.CstPDFDoc.AddOpenActionJavaScript(System.String)
member.summary: Adds specified JavaScript PDF action to this document for the viewer application "open" event.
member.param: JavaScript script that needs to be executed by viewer application "open" event.
member.remarks: A JavaScript PDF action specified in a document makes viewer applications to execute a JavaScript script in response to an event triggered by the viewer application or the end-user interacting with it. The JavaScript PDF action added by this method will be executed compliant viewer applications when the document is opened.

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.CstPDFDoc.AddOpenActionLaunch(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds specified "launch" PDF action to the viewer application "open" event.
member.param: Pathname of the file that needs to be executed or the document that needs to be opened or printed.
Whether the document needs to be opened in a new window of the viewer application.
Whether the document needs to be printed.
member.remarks:
A "launch" PDF action makes the viewer application execute an application or opens/prints a file with its default application. If the document is a PDF application, then it may be displayed by the same viewer application. Launch PDF actions are currently supported by Adobe Reader only on Microsoft Windows platform.
The launch PDF action added by this method will be launched by viewer applications when the document is opened in it.

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.CstPDFDoc.AddOpenActionGotoR(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds specified remote go-to PDF action to the document's "open" viewer application event.
member.param: Pathname of the document that needs to be opened.
Whether specified document needs to be opened in a new window.
member.remarks: A remote go-to PDF action in a document makes viewer applications to open a specified document in response to a event triggered by the viewer application or the end-user. The PDF action added by this method will be executed compliant viewer applications when the document is opened.

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.CstPDFDoc.AddOpenActionNamed(Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFActionName)
member.summary: Adds a "named" PDF action to the document for the viewer application "open" event.
member.param: Named PDF action that needs to be executed.
member.remarks: A "named" PDF action is a pre-defined viewer application operation as defined in the PDF specification, such as navigating to next page or the previous page. The named PDF action added by method will be executed by viewer applications immediately after they open and display the document.

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.CstPDFDoc.AddOpenActionURI(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a "URI" PDF action to the document for the viewer application "open" event.
member.param: URI that needs to be resolved (launched) by the viewer application.
member.remarks: A URI PDF action that makes viewer applications to resolve (launch) a URI. URI stands for Uniform Resource Identifier. It is specified as a link to a website, FTP host or an e-mail address. The URI PDF action added by this method will be launched by the viewer application when the document is opened by them.

member.summary: Extract specified number of consecutive pages from the PDF document and create new PDF documents.
member.param: Number of consecutive pages that need to be extracted for each new document.

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.CstPDFDoc.AddPageBreak
member.summary: Adds a page break.
member.remarks:
This method behaves differently when it is creating a new document and when it is modifying an existing document.
On a new document that is being created, this method creates a new page and sets it as the current page.
On an existing document, no new page is created. Instead, the next page is set as the current page for subsequent content-creation method.

member.name: T:Gnostice.PDFOne.EncryptedLicense
member.summary: Defines an encrypted license for a component or control generated using the Infralution Licensing System.
member.remarks: The Infralution Licensing System provides a secure way of licensing .NET controls, components and applications. Licenses are protected using public key encryption to minimize possibility of cracking.

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.EncryptedLicense.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Create a new Infralution Encrypted License
member.param: The key for the license
The serial number of the license
The product data associated with the license

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.EncryptedLicense.Dispose
member.summary: Cleans up any resources held by the license

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.EncryptedLicense.Checksum(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a three character checksum based on the given input string
member.param: The input string to return a checksum for
member.returns: An checksum that can be used to validate the given input string

remarks.para: This function can be used to generate a short checksum that can be embedded in a license key as . This allows you to tie the license key to information supplied by the user (for instance the name of the purchaser) without having to include the full information in the license key. This enables license keys to be kept reasonably short.

When the license is checked by the application it performs a checksum on the information supplied by the user and checks that it matches the information in the ProductInfo that was generated when the license was issued. The License Tracker application provides support for "CustomGenerators" which allow you provide the code to generate the ProductInfo from customer and other information.

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.EncryptedLicense.HashString(System.String)
member.summary: Implements a string hashing code algorithm equivalent to the .NET 2003 String.GetHashCode()
member.remarks: Microsoft have changed the underlying String.GetHashCode algorithm. This method provides an equivalent compatible method that can be used on all platforms returning the same result.
member.param: The string to get the hash code for
member.returns: The hash code

member.name: T:Gnostice.PDFOne.EncryptedLicenseProvider
member.summary: Defines a .NET LicenseProvider that uses encrypted licenses generated by the Infralution Licensing System.

remarks.p: The Infralution Licensing System provides a secure way of licensing .NET controls, components and applications. Licenses are protected using public key encryption to minimize possibility of cracking.
Components or controls use the to specify this class as the LicenseProvider

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.EncryptedLicenseProvider.SetParameters(System.String)
member.summary: Set the parameters used to validate licenses created by this provider.
member.remarks: This must be called by the client software prior to obtaining licenses using the EncryptedLicenseProvider. The parameters are generated using the Infralution License Key Generator and pasted into the calling client code.
member.param: An XML string containing parameters used to validate licenses

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.EncryptedLicenseProvider.GenerateLicenseParameters(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,Gnostice.PDFOne.TextEncoding)
member.summary: Generate the XML license parameter string that is used to validate licenses generated using the given password
member.param: The password used to encrypted the license data

The keyStrength defines the size (in bytes) of the key verified by public key encryption. The longer the key the harder it is to break the licensing scheme by brute force. Note that increasing the key strength increases the length of the generated keys. A KeyStrength of 7 will generate keys that are 32 characters long. A KeyStrength of 8 to 15 will generate keys that are 48 characters long

Is a checksum of the included in the key. The checksum is used to validate that the contents of the are valid. This is really only required if the length of the is 7 or more characters long. For of less than 7 characters the ProductInfo is validated by the encryption algorithm.
The encoding used to convert the key data to and from text
member.returns: An XML string which is used to initialise the EncryptedLicenseProvider

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.EncryptedLicenseProvider.GenerateKey(System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,Gnostice.PDFOne.TextEncoding,System.Int32)
member.summary: Generate a new encrypted license using the given password
member.param: The strength of the key to generate
The password used to encrypted the license data
User defined data about the product being licensed

Is a checksum of the included in the key. The checksum is used to validate that the contents of the are valid. This is really only required if the length of the is 7 or more characters long. For of less than 7 characters the ProductInfo is validated by the encryption algorithm.
The encoding used to convert the key to text
The unique license serial number
member.returns: An encrypted license key
member.remarks: If there is no installed license for the Infralution Licensing System then the only allowed password is "TEST" and the only allowed serial numbers are 1 or 0. To use the licensed version of this method ensure that the file Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicenseProvider.lic exists in the same directory as the Infralution.Licensing.dll and contains a valid license key for the Licensing System.

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.EncryptedLicenseProvider.InstallLicense(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Install a license key for the given component or control type.

remarks.para: This method is used to install licenses for components and controls. The method is typically better for installing application licenses because it provides more control over the license key file name. This license key file used by this method is the full type name followed by a ".lic" suffix.

This method verifies that the key is valid and if it is creates the license file and stores the license key. The generic Infralution.Licensing.LicenseInstallForm uses this method to install licenses for types. Client components may implement their own registration forms that call this method.
The method MUST be called before using this method.

member.param: The type to install the license for
The license key to install
member.returns: A license if succesful or null/nothing if not

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.EncryptedLicenseProvider.InstallLicense(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Install a license key for an application in the given file.

remarks.para: This method is used to install licenses for applications. Use the method to install licenses for components or controls. If a full path is not specified for licenseFile then the file will be created relative to the entry executable directory.

This method verifies that the key is valid and if it is creates a license file with the given name and stores the license key. This method is used by client applications to allow customers to install a license for an application. The generic Infralution.Licensing.LicenseInstallForm uses this method to install licenses for applications. Client applications may implement their own registration forms that call this method.
The method MUST be called before using this method.

member.param: The name of the file to install the license key in
The license key to install
member.returns: A license if succesful or null/nothing if not

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.EncryptedLicenseProvider.InstallLicense(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Install a license key for an application in the given file.

remarks.para: This method is used to install licenses for applications. Use the method to install licenses for components or controls. If a full path is not specified for licenseFile then the file will be created relative to the entry executable directory.

This method verifies that the key is valid and if it is creates a license file with the given name and stores the license key. This method is used by client applications to allow customers to install a license for an application. The generic Infralution.Licensing.LicenseInstallForm uses this method to install licenses for applications. Client applications may implement their own registration forms that call this method.
This method is an alternative to calling followed by .

member.param: An XML string containing parameters used to validate the license key
The name of the file to install the license key in
The license key to install
member.returns: A license if succesful or null/nothing if not

member.summary: Get a license (if installed) from the given license file.

member.summary: Get a license (if installed) for the given component/control type
member.param: The context (design or runtime)
The type to get the license for
The object the license is for
If true a is thrown if a valid license cannot be loaded
member.returns: An encrypted license

remarks.para: This method is used to get licenses for components and controls. Applications should generally use the method as it provides more control over the license file that keys are stored in. This method is not typically called directly by application code. Instead the component or control uses the or methods which find the for the type and call this method.
You must call before calling this method either directly or indirectly by via a call to

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.EncryptedLicenseProvider.GetLicense(System.ComponentModel.LicenseContext,System.Reflection.Assembly,System.Type)
member.summary: Return the license for the given type from a given DLL assembly resources
member.param: The license context to validate the license in
The assembly containing the license
The type to get the license for
member.returns: The license key if any
member.remarks: This method can be used to check the given DLL assembly for a license. By default the .NET licensing framework only checks the entry assembly (ie typically executables) for licenses. This means that if a licensed control is wrapped in another control, the customer of the wrapped control will still required a design time license key for the original control. This is generally the behaviour that control authors would like. If however you want to provide a license that enables a customer to create new component/controls using your control/component then you can achieve this by using this method to check for a license in the CallingAssembly that created the control/component.

User defined data about the product being licensed

Is a checksum of the included in the key. The checksum is used to validate that the contents of the are valid. This is really only required if the length of the is 7 or more characters long. For of less than 7 characters the ProductInfo is validated by the encryption algorithm.
The encoding used to convert the key to text
The unique license serial number

member.name: T:Gnostice.PDFOne.EvaluationMonitor
member.summary: Provides a mechanism for managing time/usage limited evaluations of products.

remarks.para: Instantiate an instance of this class to read/write the evaluation parameters for the given product. The is set the first time that the class is instantiated. The and properties are set each time the class is instantiated (or once per day if the property is set to true).

Note that evaluation data must be stored somewhere on the users hard disk. It is therefore not too difficult for a sophisticated user to determine the changes made either to registry keys or files (using file/registry monitoring software) and restore the state of these to their pre-installation state (thus resetting the evaluation period). For this reason it is recommended that you don't rely on this mechanism alone. You should also consider limiting the functionality of your product in some way or adding nag screens to discourage long term use of evaluation versions.

If you have a data oriented application you can increase the security of evaluations by storing the current somewhere in your database each time the application runs and cross checking this with the number returned by the EvaluationMonitor.

member.name: M:Gnostice.PDFOne.EvaluationMonitor.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the evaluation monitor.
member.param: Should the usage count only be incremented once per day
A string which uniquely identifies the product
member.remarks: If countUsageOncePerDay is set to true then the is only incremented once for each day that the product is actually used. If countUsageOncePerDay is false then the is incremented each time a new evaluation monitor is instantiated for a product

member.name: T:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFAnnotFlags
member.summary: Defines PDF annotation or form field settings.

member.name: F:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFAnnotFlags.Hidden
member.summary: Viewer will not display the annotation if it does not belong to one of the standard annotation types. The annotation handler will not be available. If this flag is clear, the unknown annotation will be displayed using the appearance stream specified by its appearance dictionary, if any.

member.name: F:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFAnnotFlags.Print
member.summary: The user will not be able to interact with the annotation. The annotation will not be displayed nor will it be printed. This is regardless of the annotation type or handler availability. You can use this flag where screen space is limited.

member.name: F:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFAnnotFlags.NoZoom
member.summary: Will print the annotation when the page is printed. If clear annotation will not be printed even though visible on the screen. This property has no effect when used with link annotation.

member.name: F:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFAnnotFlags.NoRotate
member.summary: The annotation will not be magnified at all. It will not match the scale of the page when the page is zoomed. The annotation will hold on to its location.

member.name: F:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFAnnotFlags.NoView
member.summary: The annotation will not be rotated. It will not match the rotation of the page. The annotation will hold on to its location and appearance.

member.name: F:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFAnnotFlags.ReadOnly
member.summary: The annotation will not be displayed on the screen. The user will not be able to interact with it. The annotation may be printed if the Print flag is on.

member.name: F:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFAnnotFlags.Locked
member.summary: The user will not be able to interact with the annotation. The annotation will not respond to mouse clicks and mouse motions. Display and print of the annotation depends on the settings of NoView and Print flags.

member.name: F:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFAnnotFlags.ToggleNoView
member.summary: The user will not be able to delete the annotation. The user will not be able to modify the properties of the annotation including position and size. However, there is no restriction on the changes to the annotation's contents, such as the value of a form field.

member.summary: Contents of the annotation rectangle need to be displayed without any change from the normal appearance.

member.name: F:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFLinkAnnotHighlightMode.Outline
member.summary: Contents of the annotation rectangle need to be inverted.

member.name: F:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFLinkAnnotHighlightMode.Push
member.summary: Border of the annotation rectangle needs to be inverted.

member.name: T:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFTransitionStyle
member.summary: Defines PDF .

member.name: F:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFTransitionStyle.Split
member.summary: Page elements different from the previous page do not float but simply scale their size to or from the value specified by .

member.name: F:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFTransitionStyle.Blinds
member.summary: Two lines sweep across to display the page.

member.name: F:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFTransitionStyle.Box
member.summary: Horizontal or vertical blinds that sweep downward or to the right to display the page.

member.name: F:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFTransitionStyle.Wipe
member.summary: A box that either moves from the edges to the center or otherwise to reveal the page.

member.name: F:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFTransitionStyle.Dissolve
member.summary: A single line sweeps across the screen in the direction specified by to revealing the new page.

member.name: F:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFTransitionStyle.Glitter
member.summary: The page is revealed by gradually dissolves the previous page.

member.name: F:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFTransitionStyle.Fly
member.summary: the page is displayed gradually, as wide band moves from one side of the previous page to the other side in the direction specified by .

member.name: F:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFTransitionStyle.Push
member.summary: Page elements that are different from the previous page float in or out to a location that is offscreen.

member.name: F:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFTransitionStyle.Cover
member.summary: Page pushes out the previous page in the direction specified by .

member.name: F:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFTransitionStyle.Uncover
member.summary: The page slides in from the direction specified by .

member.name: F:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFTransitionStyle.Fade
member.summary: Page is revealed, as the previous page slides off the direction specified by .

member.name: T:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFPage
member.summary: Represents a PDF page instance.
member.value:
Use this instance to: 1. Access a page in an existing PDF document. 2. Create a new page in a new PDF document or an existing one. This class has a full complement of page-specific methods available in the class.
Use methods in this class to add page elements such as text, images shapes, annotations or form fields to a single PDF page. For example, to add a form field to a page, use method. Use a method to render an image on a page. To reproduce content on a page, say a page template, use method.
Use method in this class to and determine other page information from an existing PDF document.
To retrieve a page in an existing PDF document, use method. Before this, get the total number of pages in a document using . The pages are numbered from 1 (one), not 0 (zero).
After creating a page, add it to a PDFDocument instance using
method.

member.name: T:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFAppearanceStream
member.summary: This class represents a PDF appearance stream.
member.value: An appearance stream is a rectangular region (on a virtual page) containing PDF elements such as shapes, images, and text. After creating an appearance stream object, it can be used on any PDF page. It also can be used to provide an alternate appearance to PDF elements such as form fields and annotations. The x-y coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle will be relative to the x-y coordinate of the top-left corner of the form field or annotation for which it used. After creating an PdfAppearanceStream object with a specified rectangle, use its methods such as or to create content in it.

member.name: T:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFFileAttachmentAnnot
member.summary: This class represents a file attachment annotation.
member.value: A file attachment annotation is used to embed file attachments in a PDF document.

member.name: T:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFFormCheckBox
member.summary: This class represents a check box form field.
member.value: Viewer applications allow users to select or deselect a check box form field. When the check box is selected, it is supposed to be in an on state. When it is selected, the field is supposed to be in an off state. When the form is submitted, a check box in an on-state submits its name as the value. If the check box is not selected, then the field's value will be "off" and it will not be among the fields that are submitted by the users.

member.name: T:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFFormComboBox
member.summary: This class represents a combo box.
member.value: A combo box provides a drop-down list containing several text options. If the list is made editable, then users can be allowed to enter a text option that is not already in the list.

member.name: T:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFFormListBox
member.summary: This represents a list box.
member.value: A list box provides a scrollable list of text options. Options that are not displayed within the box can be accessed by scrolling.

member.name: T:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFFormPushButton
member.summary: This class represents a push button that can be used to submit or reset a form.
member.value: A push button can also be used to updated calculated fields. A push button can have an icon and a caption, but does not hold any value.

member.name: T:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFFormRadioItem
member.summary: This class represents a radio button option form field.
member.value: A radio button option is usually part of a radio button form field. On a viewer application, end-users are usually allowed to select only one radio button option on a radio button form field.

member.name: T:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFFormTextField
member.summary: This class represents a text box form field

member.name: T:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFFreeTextAnnot
member.summary: This class represents a free text annotation.
member.value: A free text annotation is displayed directly on the page. The "content" text for the annotation is displayed on the page. A callout line can be associated with the annotation rectangle of the free text annotation.

member.name: T:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFInkAnnot
member.summary: This represents an ink annotation.
member.value: An ink-annotation is identified by a "free-hand scribble" made up one or more lines. The lines are specified by the x-y coordinates of their vertices.

member.name: T:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFLineAnnot
member.summary: This class represents a line annotation.
member.value: A line annotation is represented by a straight line. The line has a starting point and an ending point. A line annotation can have a popup dialog box.

member.name: T:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFMarkupAnnot
member.summary: This class represents a text markup annotation.
member.value: A markup annotation can be used to mark up text by adding styles such as underline, squiggly, strike-out and highlight. The style applied to the text is specified using a quadrilateral. The rectangle is specified by x and y coordinates of its top-left, top-right, bottom-left and bottom-right corners (exactly in this sequence).

member.name: T:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFPolygonAnnot
member.summary: This class represents a polygon annotation.
member.value: A polygon annotation is a closed figure made of straight lines. To specify the shape of the polygon, set the property.

member.name: T:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFPolylineAnnot
member.summary: This class represents a polyline annotation.
member.value: A polyline annotation represents a set of lines representing an open or closed figure. A polyline annotation is built around a set of points that form the starting and ending points of the lines. A polygon annotation is derivation of the polyline annotation where a closed figure is formed.

member.name: T:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFPopupAnnot
member.summary: This class represents a popup annotation.
member.value: A popup annotation is actually the popup window of another annotation and hence cannot exist independently. A popup can be set for annotation using method.

member.name: T:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFPresentation
member.summary: This class represents a PDF page transition.
member.value: A page transition specifies a certain graphical special effects to applied when a page is displayed on a viewer application. If a pages in a document are to be displayed as a slide show, then transitions can make the display of the pages more attractive. Several types of transitions have been defined in this class - one of which can be applied to a page.

member.name: T:Gnostice.PDFOne.PDFStampAnnot
member.summary: This class represents a stamp annotation.
member.value: This class provides numerous constructors for creating a stamp annotations. By default, the annotation icon will be that of "DRAFT." To change the icon, set the property. You can also change the way in which the annotation is displayed, allowed to interact with the user, or printed.

Note PDF has no concept of tables. The table will be broken down to line draws and textouts.
